result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie J Hinds

Court granted defense motion. New date selected with the parties via email,
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Adjourn today's plea and sentencing hearings.

Received and filed: Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS Report.

Defendant Jessie J Hinds in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's Waukesha County case has not yet resolved. Defense is asking for an adjourned plea and sentencing date.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Jessie J Hinds in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea hearing. Court granted defense's request. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 03-31-2022
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jessie J Hinds in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  William R. F. Ackell, appearing for Stephan Nolten, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear via Zoom video.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defendant is requesting other counsel; Court holds colloquy with defendant and advises defendant that Atty. Lamke will be meeting with him to review the case.
Court orders case adjourned for further scheduling conference in Branch 45.

Defense counsel request to modify the level of supervision due to their requirements that appointments be in person.
Discussion with the parties; Zoom video is available at his current residence.

Court orders that the Level 5 supervision continue however, defendant may appear for those appointments via Zoom video.

JusticePoint Supervision Report dated February 21, 2022 - received
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (missed phone contact), filed.

Defendant Jessie J Hinds in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jessie J Hinds in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d66d5f44-cf7a-0e03-96c5-92d4fbbd91a4  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lowe's Of Franklin, 7027 South 27th Street, Franklin, Wisconsin 53132
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Jessie J Hinds in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Jessie J Hinds in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jessie J Hinds appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 2. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
